title: c4 font
content:
Hi I am new here so please forgive me if I have made any etiquette mistakes by posting in the wrong area.

i am sure you chaps must have covered this before although a search beared no suitable results.

I am looking for a font very close to the C4 family (channel 4), really desperate to find a close match. My client did not like my first choices of Din, Aniverse or Museo - at this rate i'll be whipping out Comic Sans and hanging my head in shame.

thanks thomas
author: thomaslawrie

comments.content: C4 family? How about posting an image or link?

of course, sorry here is a link to a pdf  
 [http://img396.imageshack.us/img396/9854/c4mr6.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20130124102054/http:/img396.imageshack.us/img396/9854/c4mr6.png)

Hm. A close match will be hard to find. Some suggestions:  
 [Etelka](http://web.archive.org/web/20130124102054/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-15-etelka)  
 [Neo Sans/Tech](http://web.archive.org/web/20130124102054/http:/www.fonts.com/DE/detail.htm?pid=415112)  
 [BetaSans](http://web.archive.org/web/20130124102054/http:/www.shiftype.com/fontdetail.php?m=1&p=3)

how about either Housegothic text or Simianchimpanzee text from House Industries?

[www.houseind.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20130124102054/http:/www.houseind.com/ "www.houseind.com")

JH

How about a less “technoid” / “futuristic” font?  
Check out these fonts:

[http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/sans/Antenna](http://web.archive.org/web/20130124102054/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/sans/Antenna "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/sans/Antenna")  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/sans/HerounSans](http://web.archive.org/web/20130124102054/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/sans/HerounSans "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/sans/HerounSans")  
 [http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/sans/Scout](http://web.archive.org/web/20130124102054/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/sans/Scout "http://www.fontbureau.com/fonts/sans/Scout")
thanks ever so much, good recommendations, the Etelka Monotype pro Bold comes quite close, with a little tweaking I might be able to get some of the personality of the C4 font into that.

One more suggestion from a latecomer to this thread: [Sys](http://web.archive.org/web/20130124102054/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fsd/sys/).

- Mike Yanega

As you probably know, it's a custom font by Fontsmith

[http://www.fontsmith.com/custom.php?id=487](http://web.archive.org/web/20130124102054/http:/www.fontsmith.com/custom.php?id=487 "http://www.fontsmith.com/custom.php?id=487")

However, Soho Gothic comes fairly close with one of its OpenType stylistic alternate sets (which, curiously, Monotype don't show you here):

[http://www.monotype.co.uk/sgMF/](http://web.archive.org/web/20130124102054/http:/www.monotype.co.uk/sgMF/ "http://www.monotype.co.uk/sgMF/")
